meanings.definition: To drink alcohol, especially in small quantities.
meanings.sent1: She tipples a glass of wine with dinner.
meanings.sent2: He often tipples a beer after work.
meanings.sent3: The cat tipples from the spilled glass of milk.
meanings.sent4: The stream tipples gently into the pond.
meanings.sent5: The friends tipples joyfully at the celebration.

meanings.definition: The end of something, especially a rod or cane.
meanings.sent1: The tip of the fishing rod is called the tipples.
meanings.sent2: He held the cane by its tipples.
meanings.sent3: The tipples of the broom were worn from use.
meanings.sent4: The tipples of the flag fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent5: She painted the tipples of the fence bright red.

meanings.sent1: The children played on the grassy tipples.
meanings.sent2: The tipples in the field provided a scenic view.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant climbed the tipples with effort.
meanings.sent4: The tipples of sand shifted with the wind.
meanings.sent5: The tipples of snow sparkled in the sunlight.
